meanings.definition: To outdo in a confrontation or competition.
meanings.sent1: She always outfaces her opponents in the chess tournament.
meanings.sent2: He outfaces his rival in the final round of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel outfaces the big dog in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outfaces all obstacles is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun outfaces the dark clouds, shining through with determination.

meanings.sent1: The brave knight outfaces the dragon in the epic battle.
meanings.sent2: She outfaces her fears and stands up to the bully.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse outfaces the cat, refusing to be intimidated.
meanings.sent4: His unwavering gaze outfaces any challenge that comes his way.
meanings.sent5: The fearless leader outfaces the enemy with unwavering courage.

meanings.sent1: The protesters outfaces the authorities, demanding change.
meanings.sent2: She outfaces the storm, standing strong against the wind.
meanings.sent3: The little boy outfaces his bedtime, determined to stay up late.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit outfaces any adversity, never backing down.
meanings.sent5: The lone tree outfaces the harsh winter, standing tall and resilient.
